front.title: A SIP Interface to VoiceXML Dialog Servers

abstract.t: VoiceXML is an XML based scripting language for describing voicedialogs. VoiceXML interpreters run within an interpreter contextthat, among other tasks, provides a call control interface foraccessing the interpreter. It is very natural to provide a VoIP-basedinterpreter context that uses SIP and RTP to communicate with theoutside world. In this document, we provide detailed specificationsfor a SIP/RTP based interpreter context.
